results.title: Smoking and you
results.creator_credit: Derrick Knight, Derrick Knight and Partners and Great Britain. Ministry of Health
results.brief_description: The risks of cigarette smoking, factually presented with the object of discouraging young smokers. Effects of smoking on the throat and lungs are explained in diagrams and illustrated by the cases of two heavy smokers; research with a smoking machine shows the amount of chemicals inhaled; and animated sequence shows the rise in smoking and the number of deaths from lung cancer since 1910.

results.title: Smoking and health: a report to youth
results.creator_credit: Jeff Whatley, Bailey Film Productions and Design Center
results.brief_description: If you smoke, chances are that you will get lung cancer. Is smoking worth the chance? This is the only question asked in the film and the answer must come from the viewer after they have seen how the human body is affected by smoking. The evidence against smoking is over-whelming but the decision rests with the individual.

results.title: Smile for auntie
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A gently wicked satiric animated look at an aunt’s attempt to make baby smile. About the strange behaviour adults indulge in when attempting to communicate with, and relate to an infant. The aunt is seen from a child’s eye view. From the book written and illustrated by Diane Paterson. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Smallpox: merciless traveller
results.creator_credit: Vaclav Bedrich, Czechoslovak Film Studios and World Health Organisation
results.brief_description: This animated film deals with the history of smallpox throughout the ages. Shows how it has ravaged the world from the time of the Pharoahs, the discovery of a vaccine by Edward Jenner and his fight to have it recognised by international medical authorities and how the smallpox problem is being dealt with in the present day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vaclav Bedrich, Czechoslovak Film Studios and World Health Organisation

results.title: Small planet
results.creator_credit: International Civil Aviation Organization and United Nations
results.brief_description: Jet planes in civil aviation and the services provided by ICAO. The types of jet in use; the elaborate ground services they require; the role of ICAO in studying civil aviation needs, coordinating services and supplying financial and technical asistance. Stresses the shrinkage of distance and the growth of cooperation through air travel.

results.title: Small people
results.brief_description: The fun and fascination of puppetry. Based on the work of Edith Munay, who pioneered the teaching of puppetry to Australian children. The wide range of interest includes the puppets to make, their clothes, the story to be thought of, the play to be worked out, the manipulation, the gestures and voices of the characters; glove puppets, animal puppets, rod puppets and marionettes, all are shown in this introduction to puppetry.

results.title: Small business: the company you keep
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellis, Tony Matthews and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: How to approach the problems of delegation, staff selection, and the future management of the company. As a business grows, those at the top must learn a new role. In addition to delegation, which is examined from several angles, there are important problems of communication and industrial relations.

results.title: Small boat safety: stowage, care and use of life-saving equipment
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates the do’s and don’ts of storing, caring and using life-saving equipment in small boats.
Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Small boat safety
results.brief_description: The objective of this film is to increase recognition of small boat and pleasure craft hazards and to demonstrate sound safety practice to boating, water skiing, youth and community groups.
